mate, you should post this ( maybe minus the Alan message as his was not posted on my board ) on my board, one more free advertisement.

Rich

http://members5.boardhost.com/Nihon-To/


  MASAMUNE Sano Museum Exhibition  Catalogue 2002,
  8.75"x11.5" paper covers, 169pp illustrates 59 blades
  by both b&w plates and superb oshigata. The book
  covers the Soshu trad- ition from Kunitsuna through
  Masamune to shinto makers like Shinkai and Kiyomaro.
  There is a brief English index to the plates.       
  GBP32 = USD $53.70 

  My Price: $50 USD + $10 USD shipping to the U.S.

  NIHON NO BIJUTSU #431 Swords From the Fujisawa
  Collection, by Hiroi, 7.25"x9" paper  covers, 106pp 
  of which  are plates illustrating blades and mountings
  donated to the NBTHK by Fujisawa Otoyasu.        
  GBP19 = USD $31.88

  My Price: $35 USD + $4 USD for shipping to the U.S.
  (Might have to lower my price to compete on this one)

  SOSOKI NO NIHONTO Early curved Japanese Swords. Sano
  Museum Exhibition Catalogue 2003. 8.75"x11.5" soft
  covers. 139pp illustrating 59 very early blades
  including rare Mogusa smiths, Hoki Yasutsuna, Bungo
  Yukihira and Sadahide, Choen, Kuninaga & Kanenaga.
  Explores and explains the origins of curved blades
  from the Heian to the early Kamakura period. English
  index for the plates.
  GBP32 = USD $53.70

  My Price: $50 USD + $10 USD shipping to the U.S.
  (This one's not listed on my site but I have it)

  SATSUMA KOSHIRAE by Zusho, 62x8.5", 129pp of which 38
  are plates (16 in colour) illustrating the various
  types of sword mountings po[pular in Satsuma, plus
  16pp of illustrations from the Satsuma auction sale
  catalogue of 1928.
  GBP31 = USD $52.02

  My Price: $55 USD + $4 USD shipping to the U.S.
  (Might have to lower my price to compete on this one) 

  I'm hoping that after the holidays or during my off
  time during the holiday break I'll get a chance to
  update my site. But if anyone has any questions please
  drop me an email and ask.

  Bob R
